item.title: Create Microservice Gateway
item.description:
This section describes how to create a microservice gateway.

During the creation of a microservice gateway, a deployment running Spring Cloud Gateway is actually created.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

  • You should prepare the Spring Cloud Gateway container image in advance. For more information, see the Spring Cloud Gateway documentation. This section uses the registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/kse/spring-cloud-gateway:latest container image as an example. You can also build your own container image as needed.

item.title: View Microservice Gateway Information
item.description:

item.title: View Microservice Gateway Details
item.description:
This section describes how to view microservice gateway details.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Viewing permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Viewing permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Gateways in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the page, select Manage > View Details to open the gateway details page.

  4. View the gateway’s resource attributes in the Attributes area on the left side of the gateway details page.

item.title: Edit Microservice Gateway
item.description:
This section describes how to edit a microservice gateway.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Spring Cloud > Microservice Gateways in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the page, select Manage > Edit.

  4. In the Edit Microservice Gateway dialog, modify the parameters of the microservice gateway, and then click OK.

    For more information on microservice gateway parameters, see the Parameter Description.

item.title: Delete Microservice Gateway
item.description:
This section describes how to delete a microservice gateway.

Warning

Deleting the microservice gateway will cause the microservice’s business to be interrupted. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Spring Cloud should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Spring Cloud Microservices Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".
